title: Note to the Reader
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body">This digital publication is powered by ChicagoCodeX (CCX), an open source suite of software tools that provides an authoring and publishing environment for online catalogues with full scholarly apparatus; intuitive book-like navigation; robust presentation tools for multilayered images; and personalized reader annotation tools.

The OSCI team at the Art Institute of Chicago conceived and managed the project and the development of the ChicagoCodex, which served as the foundation of the open-sourced, digital publishing platform OSCI Toolkit (). The project’s impetus and funding came from the Getty Foundation. The initial coding and technical implementation was researched and executed by the IMA Lab, a web design and development consultancy of the Indianapolis Museum of Art.

We recommend using the latest version of Chrome, Safari, or Firefox.

The following is a guide on how to cite the texts in this catalogue.

Descriptive Analysis and Related Works  
Peter Zegers, “Gauguin\_Cat. 25 Eve, Portrait of the Artist’s Mother--2002.224: Descriptive Analysis,” in Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2016), para #.

Commentary  
Richard R. Brettell and Genevieve Westerby, “Gauguin\_Cat. 1 Wood Tankard, 1880--1999.362: Commentary,” in Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2016), para #.

Technical Study  
Kristin Hoermann Lister, “Gauguin\_Cat. 1 Wood Tankard, 1880--1999.362: Technical Study,” in Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2016), para #.

Provenance/Exhibition History/Selected References/Other Documentation  
“Gauguin\_Cat. 1 Wood Tankard, 1880--1999.362: Provenance,” in Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2016), para #.

“Gauguin\_Cat. 1 Wood Tankard, 1880--1999.362: Exhibition History,” in Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2016), para #.

“Gauguin\_Cat. 1 Wood Tankard, 1880--1999.362: Selected References,” in Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2016), para #.

“Gauguin\_Cat. 1 Wood Tankard, 1880--1999.362: Other Documentation,” in Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2016), para #.

Collector Page  
“Gauguin\_Edward McCormick Blair,” in Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago, ed. Gloria Groom and Genevieve Westerby (Art Institute of Chicago, 2016), para #.

The following conventions for dating artworks are used throughout the catalogue:

1890 if executed in 1890  
c. 1890 if executed sometime around 1890  
1888 or 1889 if executed in either 1888 or 1889  
1890–93 if begun in 1890 and completed in 1893  
1890/93 if executed sometime within or around the period of 1890to 1893

For works of art by Gauguin in the collection of the Art Institute of Chicago, the following convention is used: if the front of the work contains an inscription by the artist, this is considered the primary title, followed by an English translation. With some exceptions, works without an inscription by the artist have an English-language title.

The following standard reference works on Gauguin are cited in this catalogue.

Druick/Zegers  
Douglas Druick and Peter Zegers, Paul Gauguin: Pages from the Pacific, exh. cat. (Auckland Art Gallery/Art Institute of Chicago, 1995).

Field 1973  
Richard S. Field, Paul Gauguin: Monotypes, exh. cat. (Philadelphia Museum of Art, 1973).

Field 1977  
Richard S. Field,The Paintings of the First Voyage to Tahiti (Garland, 1977).

Gray  
Christopher Gray, Sculpture and Ceramics of Paul Gauguin (Johns Hopkins University Press, 1963).

Guérin  
MarcelGuérin, L’oeuvre gravé de Gauguin (H. Floury, 1927; Alan Wofsy Fine Arts, 1980).

Kornfeld  
Elizabeth, Morgan, Harold Joachim, and Eberhard Kornfeld. Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988).

Lugt  
Frits Lugt, Les marques de collections de dessins et d’estampes (Vereenigde Drukkerijen, 1921).

Pickvance  
Ronald Pickvance, The Drawings of Gauguin (P. Hamlin, 1970).

Rewald  
John Rewald, Gauguin Drawings, Bittner Art Book (T. Yoseloff, 1958).

W  
Georges Wildenstein, Gauguin, with Raymond Cogniat and Daniel Wildenstein, vol. 1, Catalogue (Beaux-Arts, 1964).

W 2002  
Daniel Wildenstein, Gauguin: A Savage in the Making, vols. 1–2, Catalogue Raisonné of the Paintings (1873–1888), text and research by Sylvie Crussard, documentation and chronology by Martine Heudron, trans. Chris Miller (Skira/Wildenstein Institute, 2002).

</section>
